intro: Aegiphila cephalophora, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Aegiphila cephalophora is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
